communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

City of Danbury CT Human Resources All applicant data related to the open position of legal secretary from 8/1/24 until 12//18/24. All information pertaining to applicant sex, race, creed and national origin. Any and all information concerning whom of anyone was hired Any and all information concerning any restructuring, including but not limited to eliminating the position of legal secretary. Any and all information concerning applicant Anthony Provenzale, for the position of legal secretary. Any and all information concerning interview notes, information, or details about Anthony Provenzale. Any and all information concerning Anthony Provenzale rank in the city of Danbury list of hiring for the position of legal secretary.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Provenzale

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Email Logs, Debby Pope
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A log of all emails to/from the CPS Board Member, Debby Pope, from December 1, 2024 to current.

1. Please search all CPS email accounts as well as personal accounts used for public business. The log should include but not be limited to: sender, recipient(s), date and time, subject line, and attachment.

This request is made on behalf of The FOIA Bakery. Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: HHCLA and Mayor
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am seeking all communications from anyone in the Mayor's office about Homeless Healthcare Los Angeles with any of the following domains:
@lacity.org
@industrialdistrictla.org
@lapd
@kindelgagan.com

February - Sept 2024

Include attachments. 

Any Zoom Meetings held between the City from any department, Industrial District Los Angeles, LAPD, Kindel Gagen related to HHCLA. 
Calendar events with Industrial District Los Angeles, LAPD, and Kindel Gagen related to HHCLA.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

communications.subject: Re: California Public Records Act Request: HHCLA and Mayor
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scott,

I am no longer with the Mayor's Office. For CPRA requests to the Mayor's
Office, please send your request to the following email address:
myr.pra@lacity.org.

Thank you.

-- 
Rachel Teitelbaum
Deputy City Attorney
Los Angeles City Attorney's Office
200 N. Main Street
Los Angeles, CA 90012
(213) 978-7032

-- 
*****************Confidentiality Notice *************************
This 
electronic message transmission contains information
from the Office of the 
Los Angeles City Attorney, which may be confidential or protected by the 
attorney-client privilege and/or the work product doctrine. If you are not 
the intended recipient, be aware that any disclosure, copying,
distribution 
or use of the content of this information is prohibited.  If you have 
received this communication in error, please notify us immediately by 
e-mail and delete the original message and any attachments without reading 
or saving in any manner.
********************************************************************

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records related to water and wastewater utility payment plans specifically seeking records that detail the following:

Payment plan records, agreements, and supporting documentation for the following individuals from 2020 to the present--

1. All elected officials (including mayors, trustees, commissioners, and other elected and appointed officials).

2. Immediate family members (including spouses, children, parents and other immediate relatives) of the officials listed above.

For each payment plan, I am requesting the following information:

The recipient’s full name (unless prohibited by law, which I dispute as outlined below).

The address or account location related to the payment plan.

The total payment amount and schedule of payments associated with the payment plan.

The effective date of the payment plan and any records related to its approval.

All correspondence or documentation regarding how eligibility for the payment plan was determined.

I understand that under FOIA (and related state public records laws), agencies may attempt to withhold or redact the names and addresses of individuals under the claim that such information is "personal" or "private." However, I respectfully submit that in this case, such redactions would be inappropriate and contrary to the public interest.

While private citizens generally have a reasonable expectation of privacy, public officials and their immediate family members do not share the same expectation when it comes to receiving public benefits or financial relief.

The information requested (names, addresses, and payment plans) does not expose sensitive private information like Social Security numbers, financial account numbers, or health data. Instead, it reveals details of how public resources are being allocated, which is precisely the type of information public records laws are designed to make accessible.

Public disclosure is essential to allow journalists, watchdog groups, and citizens to identify patterns of favoritism or special treatment for certain individuals or groups.

Names and addresses are already found in public property records, voting rolls, and other public databases. If the recipient’s name and address are already public in other contexts, redacting them here serves no meaningful privacy interest but instead obstructs accountability.

*****If any portion of this request is denied or redacted, I ask that you provide the following:

1. The specific legal exemption(s) being claimed for each redaction or denial.

2. An explanation of how the exemption applies to the specific information being withheld.

3. A list or index of withheld documents, as required under applicable "Vaughn Index" procedures.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daelon

communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Neiss, We received your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request dated 17-Dec-24 for copies of Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:1. The after action report, the plan of the day, set list, and the trip itinerary for the U.S. Air Force Academy Cadet Chorale's December 16, 2024 White House performances.2. Correspondence between any employee, official, or officer of the U.S. Air Force Academy Cadet Chorale and the White House concerning the band’s December 16, 2024 performance.3. Copies of any musical arrangements, or recordings created in preparation or for the U.S. Air Force Academy Cadet Chorale's December 16, 2024 White House performance.Please limit your search to the period between November 1, 2024 - December 17, 2024. Because our organization has a significant number of pending FOIA requests, which prevents us from making a response determination within the statutory 20 workday requirement, we organize requests based on their complexity as required by law.  Based on the information you provided, we have placed your request in the simple track. We have assigned FOIA case number 2025-01759-F to identify your request.  Should you need to contact us about your request, please do so via email usafa.foia@us.af.mil.  In case of emergency or technology failure, please phone (719) 333-6231.  Ensure to reference your assigned case number to assist us in responding more promptly. We anticipate completing your request by 17 Feb 25 . Our policy is to process requests as quickly as we can within their respective tracks in the order they are received. You can also reach us by phone at 719-333-6231.

communications.subject: PR Request: DOCS FOR RFP 116591-03 (MUCKROCK.COM OBO TONI THOMPSON)
communications.communication:
Good morning,
Thank you for your public records request, attached above for your convenience. For the following reason, public records is unable to process this request at this time.
In Nebraska, the basic rule for open public records is set out in Neb. Rev. Stat. § 84-712 (2014). That statute provides, in pertinent part, that "all citizens of this state and all other persons interested in the examination of the public records..." shall have the right to examine records in the possession of public agencies during normal agency business hours, to make memoranda and abstracts from those records, and to obtain copies of records in certain circumstances. The request we received for the records listed above came from MuckRock.com. It requires us to respond to MuckRock.com directly, i.e., either by email to MuckRock.com, upload responsive records to a MuckRock filesharing platform, or sent the responsive records by U.S. Mail addressed to "MuckRock News" in Boston, Massachusetts. However, MuckRock.com is neither a Nebraska citizen nor an interested person and, as a result, we do not consider this third-party request to be valid under the statute referenced above.

Although no information was withheld as a result of this request due to the status of the requestor, public records provides the following appeal rights found in Neb. Rev., Stat. § 84-712.03. If you believe the withholding of information requested is in error, you have the right, pursuant to Nebraska Revised Statute § 84-712.03, to appeal the decision by filing for relief by a writ of mandamus in the District Court in Lancaster County, Nebraska or to petition the Nebraska Attorney General for review of this denial. For the purpose of an appeal, Thomas Skutt is the State official responsible for the decision to deny any portion of your request.

Nothing in this email shall be construed as a promise or guarantee, of any type, that public records responsive to your request exist or can be produced. If the public record exists, withholding or redaction may be required by applicable law.
Regards,

Thomas Skutt, Jr., JD | Public Records and Discovery Attorney III
LEGAL SERVICES
Nebraska Department of Health and Human Services
OFFICE: 402-471-7020   |   FAX: 402-742-2374
DHHS.ne.gov<http://dhhs.ne.gov/Pages/default.aspx>  |  Facebook<https://www.facebook.com/NEDHHS/>  |  Twitter<https://twitter.com/NEDHHS>  |  LinkedIn<https://www.linkedin.com/company/nebraska-department-of-health-and-human-services>
CONFIDENTIALITY NOTICE: This email message, including any attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential and privileged information.  Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure or distribution is prohibited.  If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply email and destroy all copies of the original message.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Email Metadata
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following metadata for emails sent by all accounts operated by the mayor's office between the dates of December 2, 2024 and December 10, 2024:
- Sender
- Recipient (To, CC, BCC)
- Date and time sent
- Subject

As this is a request for metadata, please do not include the email body in the returned records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse
